actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1800.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1800 — "To repeal the sunset provision of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2416.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2416 — "To amend the Taiwan Allies International Protection and Enhancement Initiative (TAIPEI) Act of 2019 to provide that the United States, as a member of any international organization, should oppose any attempts by the People's Republic of China to resolve Taiwan's status by distorting the decisions, language, policies, or procedures of the organization, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1316.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1316 — "To amend the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 relating to licensing transparency."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1724.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1724 — "To prohibit the use of funds supporting any activities within the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of the People's Republic of China."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1540.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1540 — "To provide for the imposition of sanctions with respect to forced organ harvesting within the People's Republic of China, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1486.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1486 — "To impose sanctions with respect to economic or industrial espionage by foreign adversarial companies, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 36.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 36 — "To counter the influence of the Chinese Communist Party, the Iranian Regime, and the Russian Federation in the nation of Georgia."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1512.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1512 — "To amend the Taiwan Assurance Act of 2020 to require periodic reviews and updated reports relating to the Department of State's Taiwan Guidelines."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1503.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1503 — "To combat forced organ harvesting and trafficking in persons for purposes of the removal of organs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1912.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bergman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1912 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the repayment by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs of benefits misused by a fiduciary, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 530.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bergman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 530 — "To provide for a study by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine on the prevalence and mortality of cancer among individuals who served as active duty aircrew in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: Election Assistance Commission Board of Advisors
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 214(a) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 20944), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed Mr. Donald F. McGahn II, Potomac Maryland.

actions-list.header: U.S. Election Assistance Commission Board of Advisors
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Section 214(a) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 20944), the Democratic Leader reappointed Mr. Brian Michael Lemek, Potomac, Maryland.

Pursuant to section 18(c)(2)(A)(i)(VIII) and (IX) of the Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act (Public Law 118-49), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the serve as a Commissioner to the FISA Reform Commission: Mr. Himes. The Democratic Leader also appointed the following individuals to serve as Commissioners to the FISA Reform Commission: Ms. Sharon Bradford Franklin of Bethesda, Maryland, and Mr. Glenn Steven Gerstell of Washington, District of Columbia.
Pursuant to section 703(c) of the Public Interest Declassification Act of 2000 (50 U.S.C. 361 note), the Democratic Leader appointed the Honorable Valdez Butler Demings, Orlando, Florida.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on May 1, 2025, at 3:40 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 307, S. 616, S.J. Res. 31, H.J. Res. 42, and H.J. Res. 75; and that the Senate agreed to H. Con. Res. 9.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
